Node.definition: = action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions
= man; ◄ from the land of Uz (עוּץ) ► main character of book of Job

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
literally: hand; hence: = process by which humans or deties engage in an act of violence against (other) humans
literally: (someone's) hand is heavy (against someone else); hence: = action by which a deity is chastising humans
= act by which humans make a deep inarticulate sound ◄ caused by pain, grief, or severe suffering

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= process by which humans or animals discover the person, animal, object or location they were looking for
particle linking an event to a point in space; = relation indicating that event X ends at point in space Y
= a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
literally: to fill (one's) mouth (with arguments); hence: = action by which humans are actively engaged in speaking
= action by which someone speaks in order to defend oneself or to accuse someone else; sometimes accompanied by actions
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= action in which humans or deities respond to a question or situation, either by words or by actions

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force
= action by which humans initiate a possible argument or conflict with other humans or with a deity by accusing them of wrongdoing or by taking action in a different way
= particle limiting the focus to one phrase and so enhancing its truth value
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to place (responsibility on someone) > to lay upon|to bring upon|to impose upon|to charge with|to commit to
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities hold (other) humans responsible for an event that has taken place or that is to take place in the future
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: to be judged; hence: = process by which humans are declared innocent by someone with judicial authority
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant

= pertaining to a movement in a direction away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces; ≈ since the way the ancient Israelites oriented themselves was facing the East, the term is also often used to denote the West; also associated with failure, unfaithfulness, and outright rebellion

Node.gloss: to consider|to pay heed|to perceive|to realize|to understand|to distinguish
Node.definition: = process by which someone gains knowledge and understanding by observing carefully in order to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence
‎literally: left; hence: = a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the left of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= to turn around to face a different direction
‎literally: right; hence: = a cardinal direction indicating the direction to the right of a person when facing the direction of the rising sun

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= causative action by which deities improve the character of humans by leading them through difficult circumstances, ◄ like a goldsmith improves the quality of a precious metal by smelting it in the fire and so removing all contaminants
= metal of a bright yellow color, ◄ found in rocks and alluvial deposits ► and used as a monetary standard and in jewellery and plating; ≈ associated with wealth, beauty, and prosperity

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

literally: the act or movement of putting one leg in front of the other in walking, used exclusively in a figurative way to denote part of one's journey through life; hence: = something that is being done and, when God is the agent, something that other people ought to do as well; at the same time one can easily slip and fall, which is a metaphor for failure

Node.gloss: to hold on (to a type of behavior)
Node.definition: literally: to hold on to a quality as if it were a person; hence: = to act in accordance with a certain quality
literally: foot, here used metonymically to denote the entire person or animal owning it; hence: = a human being or animal with focus on the activities for which they use their feet
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life
= action by which humans or deities act in accordance with a certain (usually) prescribed pattern of behavior, such as a law, covenant, etc.
literally: to turn aside (from the right way); hence: = action by which humans deviate from what is considered to be the right way to conduct their lives
literally: to detach oneself (from an activity); hence: = action by which humans stop engaging in an activity
= a pattern of behavior required by somebody in authority|= a certain quantity of food that an individual needs every day in order to survive
literally: to store up events in one's mind; hence: = to experience affection for an event
= words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded
= an opening in the lower part of the face of humans and animals through which food and air are taken and vocal sounds are emitted
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= state in which a countable entity is one in number

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: to cause (someone else) to turn (from an activity); hence: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans or deities to stop being engaged in a certain activity

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood
= to experience a desire to see something happen or to do something oneself; ◄ this desire is associated with one's נֶפֶשׁ (נֶפֶשׁ) ≈ and can be both good and evil

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= specific actions required by somebody in authority
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.gloss: to be in anguish|to be dismayed
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such trembling and pain

Node.gloss: to look closely|to take note|to pay attention|to consider|to understand|to draw understanding
Node.definition: = action by which someone observes something carefully, with the intention of seeing through the outward appearance of things and grasping their essence, and so gain knowledge and understanding
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= deity; ◄ of Israel; traditionally: Almighty One; better: All sufficient One (= the One every good and perfect gift comes from); ≈ another name for Israel's God

= action by which humans, divine beings, or certain events cause (other) humans to experience a state of great fear combined with severe distress, often accompanied by physical symptoms, such as trembling and pain

Node.gloss: to be destroyed|to be silenced|to be consumed
Node.definition: = process by which humans are removed from existence ◄ by (a usually unnatural) death, aggression, sickness, strong emotions, or (possibly) direct divine intervention

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion
literally: to cover; hence: = process by which certain events happen with a great intensity and are often more than the recipient can bear
= state of total absence of light; ≈ associated with suffering and death
